clinical_study.brief_title: Living Donation and Kidney Transplantation Information
clinical_study.official_title: Living Donation and Kidney Transplantation Information Made Easy (KIDNEYTIME) With Animated Video Education

lead_sponsor.agency: State University of New York at Buffalo

clinical_study.source: State University of New York at Buffalo

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to increase awareness and knowledge regarding the risks and benefits of kidney transplantation and living donation amongst patients seeking kidney transplantation and their family and friends in Buffalo, New York.

detailed_description.textblock: This prospective randomized parallel controlled trial of kidney transplant candidates receiving and educational intervention and standard of care education versus standard of care education only to improve informed decision making about kidney offers.

primary_outcome.description: Assessed by knowledge survey pre and post exposure.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in attitude about kidney offers
primary_outcome.description: Assessed by attitude survey pre and post exposure.

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by self-efficacy survey pre and post exposure.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day (During standard of care education at time of clinic visit)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of questions and value statements in regards to organ offers.

arm_group.description: Participants were exposed to 2 educational videos in addition to standard of care education.
Participants received standard of care education.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- be 18 years or older,
- understand and read English (or have a support person that helps them)
- have acceptable vision to watch videos
- be able to give consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- incarcerated
- involved in the former modeling phase of animation development.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: State University of New York at Buffalo
